fieldData.title: Increased access to unemployment benefits and sickness benefits
fieldData.title_nationalLanguage: Øget adgang til dagpenge og sygedagpenge
fieldData.calc_subMinorCategory: Extensions of  income support to workers not covered by any kind of protection scheme
fieldData.descriptionBackgroundInfo: Increased access to unemployment benefits and sickness benefits due to COVID-19: In order to mitigate the negative consequences that the spread of COVID-19 can have on unemployed and sick pay recipients, the government and all the parties of the Parliament agree to provide easier conditions for unemployed and sick pay recipients in the coming temporary period. The legal references are "LOV nr 274 af 26/03/2020" and "LOV nr 275 af 26/03/2020".
fieldData.descriptionContentOfMeasure: Unemployment benefit recipients will have increased access to unemployment benefit as the period from 1 March to 31 May does not count in the unemployed seniority. However, the person must be a member of the unemployment insurance fund during the period.The right to sickness benefit will be extended for three months. Persons who have received sickness benefit for more than 22 weeks during the period from 9 March to 9 June, in the nine preceding calendar months, i.e. when the reassessment date and cannot extend the payment of sickness benefit in accordance with the existing extension rules.Suspension of G-days: Employer's payment of unemployment benefit (G-days) to employees who are covered by a division of work or returned home is suspended.
fieldData.statusOfRegulation: New aspects included into existing measure

updates.updates::description: Due to the Corona situation, the Danish Parliament has decided to extend the temporary period by one month until 30 June 2020.
